title: Shakespeare's Globe The Duchess of Malfi (2014)
description:
Duchess of Malfi (2014)2014 starring Gemma Atterton
A BBC production Live from the Sam Wanamaker Jacobean Theatre
of the play circa 1616 AD by John Webster

Runtime 2 hr 23 minutes

IMDb  tt3773058/

Director  Dominic Dromgoole

Cast

Gemma Atterton     The Duchess
Archie Bradfield   Child (non speaking)
Giles Cooper       Silvo
David Dawson       Ferdinand
James Garnon       Cardinal
Sean Gilder        Bosola
Denis Gough        Julia
Sara MacRae        Cariola
Andrew Marr        The BBC narrator- himself
Paul Rider         Delio
Alex Waldman       Antonio

IMDb  summary

  *A television version of the Shakespeare's Globe Theatre revival of John 
Webster's Jacobean tragedy, directed by Dominic Dromgoole and with a cast led by 
Gemma Arterton.
   As a televisual piece of drama, this DUCHESS OF MALFI is compelling to watch. 
The camera focuses tightly on the protagonists' expressions, reminding us of just 
how much of a domestic tragedy Webster's work actually is. On the other hand, the 
frequent reaction-shots of the audience encircling the playing area make us aware 
of how this domestic tragedy is being played out in a very public sphere: emotions 
that are customarily kept private are openly expressed, whether the characters like 
it or not." (partial)

My notes

   This presentation of  "The Duchess of Malfi"  first appeared in torrents as a 7 
plus gigabyte file.  It took perhaps a week to download.  I used the Handbrake 
software to make a more easily obtainable mp4 version suitable for CRT playback.

  This is the first time a presentation from the Sam Wanamaker Playhouse which is on 
the grounds of the Globe Theatre in London has been on television or screen-capped by a viewer.  I thank the original uploader for it.

  The credits for cast and production are incomplete.  The whole play is here but 
terminates abruptly at the end.  What are we to make of a full IMDb listing with 
no purchaseable DVD for sale anywhere, PAL or NTSC such as the Globe has released 
through Opus Arte productions?   It terminates before the credit role gives complete notes on the production.

   I would like to get this for my public library but it only appears as a torrent 
and a listing at IMDb.  To date,  I have watched it multiple times.  The stage is lit with bees wax candles without stage lighting instruments anywhere.

   As  the Globe productions continue, many of the characters are played by 
now-recognizable actors such as James Garnon, Sarah MacRae, Paul Rider and others.  This adds to the enjoyment as they now have a bit of fan base as well.

   Encourage the Globe or BBC to get this in a boxed format.  The Wanamaker Theatre 
is unique as a playhouse, even though Blackfriars (I think in Carolina,  USA)  used 
the Jacobean style playhouse.

   For now enjoy the play, perhaps many times over as I have.  There is another 
interpretation of The Duchess of Malfi in my torrent list, that one from National 
Theatre Live and that is available for purchase.

Notes written  April 8th 2015
